snippet: The parents of SungEun Grace Lee, who is fully conscious but paralyzed from the neck down and unable to speak, are using a 24-second video as proof that she wants to remain on life support.
abstract: SungEun Grace Lee, who is fully conscious but paralyzed from the neck down and unable to speak due to terminal brain cancer, is at the center of a tug of war that pits a patient's right to die against her family's belief that taking her off life support would be tantamount to suicide; doctors at North Shore University Hospital have gone to court to testify that Lee has said in no uncertain terms that she wants to be removed from life support, but her family, which disagrees, is fighting her decision.

byline.contributor: Randy Leonard and Nate Schweber contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The parents of SungEun Grace Lee, who is fully conscious but paralyzed from the neck down and unable to speak, are using a 24-second video as proof that she wants to remain on life support.

headline.seo: In SungEun Grace Lee Case, Right to Die Is Weighed Against a Family’s Wishes
headline.main: Daughter’s Right to Die Is Weighed Against Family’s Wish to Keep Her Alive
headline.print_headline: Daughter’s Right to Die Is Weighed Against Family’s Wish to Keep Her Alive
